instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D6905: What is D6905? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input on very old Macbooks(before 2011), can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Gets 20V but wont charge the Battery + Machine power on through Battery fine
threads.message:
Hi, I have a machine that has not been liquid damaged but it's been dropped since then it stopped charging. When you plug USB-C it gives 20v but on F7000 it gives only 1 Volt. If you use an external power supply and supply 12v on F7000 machines powers on fine. Also if you connect the battery and you supply 12v on F7000 it starts charging and powers on fine but it won't charge the battery.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> present fine 3.3v
<DIODE>D6905</DIODE> : 1st Pin gets 1volt [ =<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> ], 2nd get 20v[ <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> ] and 3rd gets 19v [ <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> ]
F7000 is not burnt and tested good. If you remove F7000 it pulsing between  1volt up to 2volt all the time
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> has been replaced with new. 
I have tested all resistors around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and they have their normal values
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> gets 19v + <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> gets input 19v 

could it be anything to do with SMC signals ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Gets 20V but wont charge the Battery + Machine power on through Battery fine
threads.message:
There should be broken traces, or solders.
Do you get 20V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> with original USB-C charger?
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>MPM_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>HPWR_EN</SIGNAL>*, A/BMON, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>*.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Gets 20V but wont charge the Battery + Machine power on through Battery fine
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> =20v same with <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> = 20v
<SIGNAL>TBA_AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 4.63v
VDDA=5v
VDDP=5v
<SIGNAL>PD_TBA_MPM_DET</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>HPWR_EN</SIGNAL> =3.374v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>=3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_R_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL> = 0V

Anything Else i need to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Gets 20V but wont charge the Battery + Machine power on through Battery fine
threads.message:
Check all R/C/<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40.
Change L7030, just in case.
Remember to resolder all possible and check all traces continuity.

Dropped machine should have broken trace, or solders.
